sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 In the below figure, ABC is a right-angled triangle with \(\angle\) BAC = 90\(\degree\).\(\\\)
 (i) Prove that \(\Delta\)ADB \(\sim\) \(\Delta\)CDA.\\
 (ii) If BD = 49 cm and CD = 4 cm, find AD.\\
 (iii) Find the ratio of area of triangles ADB and CDA.\\
 center{}
 tikzpicture{}
 center{} 
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{
 (i) Since, }\angle ADB = 90\degree = \angle ADC.
 \angle C + \angle CAD = 90\degree\\
 \text{Also, }\angle DAB + \angle CAD = 90\degree = \angle A\\
 \angle DAB + \angle CAD = \angle C + \angle CAD\\ 
 \angle DAB = \angle C\\
 \text{In }\Delta ADB \text{and }\Delta CDA\\
 \angle ADB = \angle ADC \text{and }\angle DAB = \angle C\\
 \text{So, }\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA\\
 \text{(ii) Since, }\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA\\
 \dfrac{BD}{AD} = \dfrac{AD}{CD} \Rightarrow {AD}^2 = BD \times CD\\
 \Rightarrow {AD}^2 = 49 \times 4\\
 \Rightarrow AD = 14 cm.\\
 \text{(iii) As the triangle is Similar, the ratio of their area is equal to ratio of square of their any two corresponding sides.}\\
 \text{Since, }\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA\\
 \dfrac{area of \Delta ADB}{area of \Delta CDA} = \dfrac{{BD}^2}{{AD}^2} = \left(\dfrac{BD}{AD}\right)^2 = \left(\dfrac{49}{14}\right)^2\\
 \Rightarrow area of \Delta ADB : area of \\Delta CDA = 49 : 4.
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
